author: tersec
content: are (a) relay networks required to always use same builder as the first time around, and (b) is `mev-boost` explicitly spec'd and tested to always do the same thing across relay networks?

author: ralexstokes
content:
i’ll assume by relay networks you mean relays which are all single (centralized) endpoints for the moment 

and once a proposer has selected a bid (by signing over a beacon block containing the execution payload from the bid) then the relay must release the execution payload

the intent is that at this point relays have custody of the executing payload so it doesn’t really matter what the builders do

relays as spec’d shouldn’t be serving bids without verifying the execution payload and by extension having full custody of the data

author: ralexstokes
content: mev-boost does the “same thing” and there are a diversity of relay implementations that all claim to do the “same thing”
